alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 2:19PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Norton and eastern Decatur Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 219 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Oberlin to Jennings. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Norton and eastern Decatur Counties, including the following locations... Kanona. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
